title.narrative: GUY 3.1 COMMUNICATION FOR DEVELOPMENT

description.narrative: Increased understanding of children's priority issues among key decision makers and communities, including opportunities for children to express their views, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Technical Excellence In Policy And Programmes, Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Special Purpose

sector.narrative: Advocacy and partnership-building for social behaviour change
Country programme process (including UNDAF planning and CCA)

Technical assistance - Cross-sectoral communication for development

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

description.narrative: In Guyana Communication for Development became a key tool to reach out to the most vulnerable children and their families | Status:Met | As-of Date:11/01/2017

title.narrative: Quality of media reporting on children's issues

baseline.value: Limited quality of reporting, especially on sensitive issues

title.narrative: Caregivers and adolescents in target communities demonstrating improved 'key practices' in adolescent development, HIV prevention, Child Survival, Education and Participation

baseline.value: No intersectoral C4D strategy in place, Key practices and target areas to be agreed

title.narrative: % child victims in target communities who used Recovery, Reintegration, or Psychological Support Services during a 12 month period
